tutorial.title: Linktree - Part 3
tutorial.descriptionContent: Get ready to build your very own Linktree-style page, where you can showcase all your socials and other links you care about in one spot.

executableContent.instructions:
In part 3 of this project, we'll style both the text and the links. Let's start by defining a global font family.

1. Inside the `body` selector, set `font-family` to a font such as `'Trebuchet MS'` or any other you like.

You can explore different fonts by asking AI for suggestions.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Emmy

Aspiring Software Developer

Welcome to my page! I'm Emmy, an aspiring software developer. Follow my journey by checking out my social media profiles. Happy coding!

Instagram TikTok

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Now, let's define font sizes.

1. Create a new rule that targets `h2` elements and sets `font-size` to `24px`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Next up, let's make the links more visually appealing.

1. Create a new rule that targets `a` elements and set background color, color, and font size. For example:
   -  `background-color` to `slateblue`
   -  `color` to `white`
   -  `font-size` to `20px`

files.name: index.html

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use the box model to display the links better.

1. Inside the existing `a` selector, set padding, border radius, and margin. For example:
   -  `padding` to `10px`
   -  `border-radius` to `10px`
   -  `margin` to `10px`

files.name: index.html
files.content:

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use a new property called `display`. It makes each element start on a new line and take up the full width available.

1. Add the following declaration to the `a` rule:
   -  `display` to `block`

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
This looks so much better! And since the links already stand out, we can remove the underlining from them. Can you use AI to figure out how to do it?

1. Use AI to figure out how to remove the underlining from the `a` elements. 
2. Ask it to explain the changes.
